args:
When the prince bears witness to Nedrick's
past in his mental world, he learns that when he
was a boy, his only support was the voice of
Bahamut in his heart, which caused him to
yearn for power equal to the dragon. The pair
then confronts the wyrm in an epic battle.
Is this the world of Nedrick's mind?\nIt's...a wasteland.
It resembles a fortress of iron and stone.\nIs that not what you see?
I see only a fog so thick it blocks\nout everything but the sight of you.
This may be the world of Nedrick's mind,\nbut it is simultaneously a world which\nreflects your own individuality.
The world you see before you now reflects\nthe impressions you have of Nedrick.
But you should set that aside for now and\nsearch for him, for he used the same\nsorcery to enter this place.
Once Bahamut senses this, he will bend\nhis will to devouring Nedrick's spirit.
Then let's hurry and... Hmm?\nWait, what was that?
I thought I heard someone...calling me.
I hear naught but our own voices, Brother.
Is that Nedrick? I hear he's a guest\nfrom the human realm.
Heh, ＂guest.＂ More like ＂guinea pig.＂\nFor King Finlorda's experiments.
Such a pitiful fate for a child...
In any event, best not to get entangled\nwith him. I know not what the king is\nthinking, but it could well be dangerous.
(This seems like something that happened\nwhen Nedrick was a child. Am I looking\nat his memories here?)
Huh? Hey, where did you come from?\nAnd what are you doing here?
Did that kid just come out of\nthe Faewood?!
My daddy told me that if you get too close\nto the forest, faeries will steal you away.
He must've come to kidnap us!
They're right—I can't forge a life\nas a human OR a faerie.
I am completely alone...except for you.
(...Wait, I think I can hear it.\nThere's a voice coming from inside him...\nIt's...comforting him?)
I'm...the prince of Alberia?\nIs this letter real...?
(He learned that when he was a child?!)
So I'm the true seventh scion, but there's\na fake created by Finlorda there instead?
This fake version of me is with my parents\nand my siblings. He's surrounded by my\nfamily and living a fine, respected life.
And yet I'm alone! I have NOTHING!\nWhy?! Why, why, why, WHY?!
...It's precisely because I have nothing\nthat my ambition exists? Is that how you\nsee it? Hmm...
...Yes, perhaps it is meaningless to\nmourn over what was never given.
But while there is much I wasn't given,\nI DO have you. And so...
(Ngh! I can feel his suffering...\nIt's like I'm being ripped apart!)
Right you are! My name is Jinlorda.\nThat was a close call you had, Nedrick.
I don't understand. What's happening\nto my body?
My father told me to say nothing,\nbut I think it unfair not to tell you.
Have you ever felt as if there is something\nlurking inside you? Something that is\nnot yourself?
The true identity of the being inside you is\nBahamut, the Wyrm of Genesis—so called\nbecause he created the world.
If you feel any sense of good will or\naffinity for Bahamut, you would do well\nto reconsider it.

Bahamut has lost his physical body and
now seeks another so he might manifest
anew in the world—and you are his
chosen vessel for this purpose.
It is the truth. The condition of your body\nis a direct result of Bahamut attempting to\nsteal it from you.
He gave up this time because it appears\nyour body cannot withstand the process,\nbut as you grow, so will his interference.
Ask the voice within you if you doubt me.
Surely one such as the Wyrm of Genesis\nwould not bother to weave a tedious lie\nor engage in untoward deception.
You must accept your reality.\nIf you do not, all that awaits you is death,\nnever having made a decision.
Am I a vessel to get your body back?\nAm I just some...pawn?
(I heard his answer... It's exactly as\nJinlorda said.)
So that's how it's been, the entire time...
Heh. What a fool I must have looked.\nI was never more than a tool for you,\nyet I held you in such warm regard.
I thought you were my friend—my family.\nYet it was but a dream.
Very well. In that case, I'll do as Jinlorda\nsaid and accept my situation.
I am your pawn, Bahamut. I'm weak.\nPowerless. A mere tool to be used\nhowever you see fit.
I swear this to you, Bahamut: Someday\nsoon, I will obtain a power equal to yours.
Huh? Where am I now? Is this Nedrick's\nmental world? I was seeing his past, but...
Finlorda said the dragon's blood in\nmy veins was originally Nedrick's.
That must be why his spirit pulled me\nalong to view his past.
Ah! That was Bahamut—which must\nmean Nedrick is nearby.
Come, Bahamut. We settle this now.
...So you've come. Just make sure you\ndon't get in my way.
There you are, {player_name}!\nI was so worried when you disappeared!
Pay attention! We're fighting the Wyrm\nof Genesis here; if you aren't completely\nfocused, you won't have a chance.
If Bahamut is freed, the world may well\ncome to ruin. Losing here is not an option.
We're going to win for the world!\nLet's do this!
